sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

clinical_pearls: Late failure is atherosclerosis (irregular) vs intermediate failure which is hyperplasia (smooth)
Smoking cessation is the single most important intervention to prevent late failure
Vein grafts develop atherosclerosis over time - surveillance important beyond 2 years
